chessgame.board

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • chessgame.board.Board

  • public class Board
extends Object
    This class contains information about the state of the game, like pieces on the board and the state of the current turn. Methods are used to alter the state off the pieces and to update the graphical interface.
    Author:
    mattilei

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      The constructor creates a new set of pieces and sets all the attributes

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        The constructor creates a new set of pieces and sets all the attributes

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        This method sets all the pieces to their original places and regenerates the pieces lost during the game. Then it updates the gui

      • reset

        public void reset(String loadState)
        This method resets the game according to information loaded
        Parameters:
        loadState - this string contains the placement of all the pieces and other data, like the number of turns. It's split into multiple parts, first contains the location of the pieces, second the number of turns, third contains the last notification, fourth tells whether the game is over or not and the last two contain the names of the players

      • move

        public boolean move(String oldPlace,
                    String newPlace)
        This method returns true if the move of the piece from one square to another is valid. It checks if there is a piece located in the place where the piece is to be moved and then if it can be moved to the new location
        Parameters:
        oldPlace - the id of the square where the piece is moved from
        newPlace - the id of the square where the pieces is being moved to
        Returns:
        whether the move from one square to another is valid

      • lookForPiece

        public boolean lookForPiece(String id)
        Method returns true if there is a piece on the square
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the square
        Returns:
        whether there is a piece on the square

      • checkForColor

        public boolean checkForColor(String location,
                             String color)
        This method returns true if the piece on the location is the same color as the color given in the parameter
        Parameters:
        location - the location of the piece in question
        color - the color that the piece is compared to
        Returns:
        returns true if the color of the piece is the same as parameter

      • firstPartOfTheTurn

        public void firstPartOfTheTurn(String squareId)
        This method is called if no piece is yet active. It checks if the selected piece is valid and then stores the location of the selected square and paints gray all the squares where the piece can move
        Parameters:
        squareId - tells which piece was selected

      • secondPartOfTheTurn

        public void secondPartOfTheTurn(String squareId)
        This method is called if the turn is active and there is a piece that is waiting for a move order. The method will check if the move is valid and then perform the move. Afterwards the board is updated.
        Parameters:
        squareId - the id of the button that was pushed on the interface

      • checkIfCheck

        public boolean checkIfCheck(String id)
        This method is used to check if the game is in check or if a move would cause it to be in check-state.
        Parameters:
        id - the location of the piece that is being moved when this method is called. If the movements of this piece would cause a check for the player during the move, the piece is moved back
        Returns:
        returns true if a move causes or has already caused a check.

      • cancelTurn

        public void cancelTurn(String id)
        This method cancel the movement of the piece and changes it back.
        Parameters:
        id - the location of the piece that will be returned back to its original place

      • setNotification

        public void setNotification(String notification)

      • setStartingPoint

        public void setStartingPoint(String startingPoint)

      • setInterface

        public void setInterface(UserInterface gui)
        Used to attach the gui class to board.
        Parameters:
        gui - the UserInterface class that is to be attached

        public Piece getPiece(String location)
        Returns the piece from the location
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        return a Piece object from the location

      • getTurnState

        public boolean getTurnState()
        Returns true if the turn is underway
        Returns:
        if a piece has been selected in this turn, this will be true

      • getStartingPoint

        Returns:
